description: From the stem of Ancient Greek φῶς (phôs, “light”)  +‎ -ism.

entries.meaning: (psychology) A luminous appearance, image or subjective perception of a hallucinatory nature.
examples: I refer to hallucinatory or pseudo-hallucinatory luminous phenomena, photisms, to use the term of the psychologists.

entries.meaning: The color that a synesthete may report seeing in association with a particular letter or number.
